content.description: A researcher hypothesizes that, in mice, two autosomal dominant traits, trait Q and trait R, are determined by separate genes found on the same chromosome. The researcher crosses mice that are heterozygous for both traits and counts the number of offspring with each combination of phenotypes. The total number of offspring produced was <math alttext="64" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>64</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>. The researcher plans to do a chi-square analysis of the data and calculates the expected number of mice with each combination of phenotypes.
content.question: Which of the following is the expected number of offspring that will display both trait Q and trait R?
